edu.biu.scapi.interactiveMidProtocols.sigmaProtocol.elGamalEncryptedValue

Class SigmaElGamalEncryptedValueCommonInput

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.biu.scapi.interactiveMidProtocols.sigmaProtocol.elGamalEncryptedValue.SigmaElGamalEncryptedValueCommonInput
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    SigmaCommonInput, ZKCommonInput, java.io.Serializable

    public class SigmaElGamalEncryptedValueCommonInput
extends java.lang.Object
implements SigmaCommonInput
    Concrete implementation of SigmaProtocol input, used by the SigmaElGamalEncryptedValue verifier and simulator.

    There are two versions of SigmaElGamalEncryptedValue protocol, depending upon if the prover knows the secret key or it knows the randomness used to generate the ciphertext.

    This common input contains an ElGamal public Key, the encrypted value x, the ciphertext and a boolean indicates is the prover knows the secret key or the random value.

    Author:
    Cryptography and Computer Security Research Group Department of Computer Science Bar-Ilan University (Moriya Farbstein)
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

        public SigmaElGamalEncryptedValueCommonInput(boolean isRandomness,
                                     ElGamalOnGroupElementCiphertext cipher,
                                     ElGamalPublicKey publicKey,
                                     GroupElement x)
        Sets the given ciphertext, public key and encrypted value.

        There is also an argument represents if the encryption was done by private key knowledge or by a randomness knowledge.

        Parameters:
        isRandomness - represents if the encryption was done by private key knowledge or by a randomness knowledge.
        cipher - ciphertext outputed by the encryption scheme on the given x
        publicKey - used to encrypt.
        x - encrypted value
